article_node.title: NVDA: Top Analysts Lift Nvidia Targets Ahead of Earnings -- Can AI Boom Deliver?
article_node.summary: Analysts are raising Nvidia’s price targets ahead of its August 27 Q2 earnings, citing robust AI demand, a dominant market position, and easing U.S. export restrictions. Consensus estimates project earnings of $1.01 per share on $45.87 billion in revenue, with KeyBanc and Susquehanna lifting targets to $215 and $210 respectively. Both analysts highlight the data‑center segment and upcoming GB300 product line as growth catalysts, while noting that China sales could add $2‑$3 billion if license approvals are secured. Institutional investors are also increasing holdings, reflecting confidence in Nvidia’s continued expansion and profitability.
